title: Clones of Borel Boolean Functions
abstract:
We study the lattice of all Borel clones on $2 = \{0,1\}$: classes of Borel
functions $f : 2^n \to 2$, $n \le \omega$, which are closed under composition
and include all projections. This is a natural extension to countable arities
of Post's 1941 classification of all clones of finitary Boolean functions.
Every Borel clone restricts to a finitary clone, yielding a "projection" from
the lattice of all Borel clones to Post's lattice. It is well-known that each
finitary clone of affine mod 2 functions admits a unique extension to a Borel
clone. We show that over each finitary clone containing either both $\wedge,
\vee$, or the 2-out-of-3 median operation, there lie at least 2 but only
finitely many Borel clones. Over the remaining clones in Post's lattice, we
give only a partial classification of the Borel extensions, and present some
evidence that the full structure may be quite complicated.
